favourite.article: This hymn reminds me of the commission our Master has charged us with, go forth and preach the gospel to all mankind, baptizing them into the Triune God. This is a sobering word from the Lord Jesus to all the saints all over the world! I'm really humbled by this hymn. Jesus is Lord! Amen!

I knew of this song since I was a child, we used to sing it in our school all the time, never thought of the words, until over forty years it began to sink into my heart about the wonderful words the writer put into it, it's refreshing, soothing and encouraging. It makes you want to serve the Living God more and more.

Tears, tears, tear.... Still thinking of the wasted years of idleness and slothfulness. I must not go an empty handed. I must not meet my saviour so. Not even a soul to greet Him? Noooo.........not so..... Nooo. He must smile upon beholding my face....
So inspiring and challenging enough to push you on in the Christian faith and struggle.

When I first heard this music, I loved it from the start but did not know all the lyrics, and now that I have found the lyrics I love it the more. Good piece of poetry. Thank You God, You reign forever and ever. AMEEEEEN.
